transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Alright team, we're one week post-launch. Let's do a quick retrospective - what went well, what didn't, and what we'd do differently. I'll start.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: What went well: The launch was smooth. No major bugs in production. The onboarding flow worked really well - we're seeing 85% completion rate. And Derek's marketing push got us great initial traction.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: What didn't go well: We underestimated the server load on launch day. Had to scale up quickly. Also, the payment flow had a small UX issue that confused some users - we fixed it, but it shouldn't have shipped.

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: From engineering side, I'm happy with how stable everything is. The OAuth integration that gave us trouble early on ended up being rock solid. What I'd change: I wish we'd done more load testing before launch. That server scaling issue could have been avoided.

transcripts.speaker: Aisha Patel
transcripts.text: Design-wise, the feedback has been really positive. Users love the onboarding tutorial. But I do think we could have done more user testing on the payment flow - that UX issue Chris mentioned was something we could have caught earlier.

transcripts.speaker: Derek Nguyen
transcripts.text: Marketing launch exceeded expectations. We hit 2,000 signups in the first week. The App Store featuring helped a lot. What I'd do differently: I wish we'd prepared more content ahead of time - blog posts, case studies. We're playing catch-up now.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Good points everyone. Let's capture some action items. First, we need to establish better load testing practices. Chris, can you document our current infrastructure and create a load testing plan?

transcripts.speaker: Chris Park
transcripts.text: Yeah, I'll have that done by next week. I'll also set up better monitoring so we catch these issues earlier.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Second, we should formalize our user testing process. Aisha, can you create a lightweight process we can follow for future features?

transcripts.speaker: Aisha Patel
transcripts.text: Absolutely. I'll draft something this week. Maybe 2-3 user tests per major feature before we ship.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: And Derek, let's plan content ahead of time for future launches. Can you create a content calendar template?

transcripts.speaker: Derek Nguyen
transcripts.text: For sure. I'll create a template and start planning content for the next feature release.

transcripts.speaker: Maya Rodriguez
transcripts.text: Perfect. Overall, I'm really proud of what we shipped. This was a great launch. Let's keep the momentum going.
